SEARCH
Package com.project.moviebooking.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
com.project.moviebooking.controller.AuthController
@Controller @RequestMapping("api/auth") public class AuthController extends Object
This is a controller class for authentication purposes. The API requests for authentication activities are declared here. The methods to authenticate the user, sign up the user and other related activities are present here.

    private UserServiceImpl
    userService
    This object is for accessing the functions of the user service layer.

  • Field Details

    • userService

      @Autowired private UserServiceImpl userService
      This object is for accessing the functions of the user service layer.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthController

      public AuthController()

  • Method Details

    • signup

      @PostMapping("/signup") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> signup(@RequestBody UserRequest userRequest)
      This method is used for signing up of the user. An OTP is sent to the email of the user which needs to be verified in order to use the account.
      Parameters:
      userRequest - Contains the information of the user that is required.
      Returns:
      An object is returned containing the message if the user was successfully registered and otp was sent or not. The message contains the error message in the case of any error.

    • verifyUser

      @PatchMapping("/verify") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> verifyUser(@RequestParam String emailId, @RequestParam String otp)
      This method is used for verifying the email of the user, using the otp that was sent to the mail.
      Parameters:
      emailId - This is the email of the user on which the OTP was sent.
      otp - This the OTP that was sent on the mail.
      Returns:
      An object is returned containing the message if the user was successfully verified or not. The message contains the error message in the case of any error.

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> login(@RequestBody AuthenticationRequest data)
      This method is used for logging into the system.
      Parameters:
      data - This contains the username and password of the user which is needed for the login process.
      Returns:
      An object is returned with the access token and refresh token along with a message otherwise in the case of error, an error message is returned.

    • refreshToken

      @PostMapping("/refresh-token") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> refreshToken(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      This method is used for refreshing the access token which is done by using the refresh token.
      Parameters:
      request - This is the request from which header is taken out in order to get the refresh token.
      response - This is the response that is used to interact with the HTTP response and sent back to the client.
      Returns:
      An object is returned with the access token and the same refresh token along with a message otherwise in the case of error, an error message is returned.

    • forgetPassword

      @PatchMapping("/forget-password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> forgetPassword(@RequestParam String emailId)
      This method is used in the case when the user forgets the password and requires to set a new password.
      Parameters:
      emailId - This is the email of the user which will be used to send the OTP for changing the password.
      Returns:
      An object is returned containing the message if the otp was sent or not for changing the password. The message contains the error message in the case of any error.

    • verifyOtpForgetPassword

      @PatchMapping("/forget-password-verify") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> verifyOtpForgetPassword(@RequestParam String emailId, @RequestParam String otp, @RequestParam String password)
      This method is used for verifying the OTP for the password change, if the OTP matches then the new password is set.
      Parameters:
      emailId - This is the email of the user who wants to change the password.
      otp - This is the OTP that is sent to the email for password change.
      password - This is the new password that the user wants to set.
      Returns:
      An object is returned containing the message if the password was successfully changed or not. The message contains the error message in the case of any error.

    • resendOTP

      @PatchMapping("/resend-otp") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> resendOTP(@RequestParam String emailId)
      This method is used for resending the OTP in the case of verifying the user when the use may not get the OTP mail.
      Parameters:
      emailId - This is the mail on which the OTP needs to sent again for the verification of the user.
      Returns:
      An object is returned containing the message if the otp was sent or not again for verification. The message contains the error message in the case of any error.
